gurmukhi: dws khY ibnqI kr joir kY sXwm BnY hir jU suin lIjY ]kop icqy qumry mrIAY su kiRpw kir hyrq hI pl jIjY ]
transliteration: Daas Kahai Bintikar Jor(i) Kai Syaam Bhanai Har(i) Joo Soun(i) Leejai|| Kop Chite Toumredareeai Su Kridaa Kar(i) Heart Hipal Jeejai||
translation: “O Lord ! this servant of yours is requesting you with folded hands, kindly listen to it; if you get angry, we shall feel ourselves like dead, therefore kindly remain gracious;

gurmukhi: AwnMd kY iciq bYTo sBw mih dyKhu jgXo ky hyq pqIjY ]hau pRB jwn kro ibnqI pRB jU pun kop iCmwpn kIjY ]2349]
transliteration: Oonand Kai Chittee Baitho Sabhaa Maih Dekhoh Jagya Ke Het Pateejai|| Hav Prabh Jaan Daro Bintiprabh Joo Poun Kop Chhimaapan Keejai||2349||
translation: Kindly sit in the court blissfully and supervise the Yajna; O Lord! I am requesting you to kindly end your anger and to forgive us.”2349.

gurmukhi: bYTwXo jdurwie ko bhu ibnqI kir BUp ]kMjn sy diRg ijh bny bnXo su mYn srUp ]2350]
transliteration: Baithaayo Jaduraae Ko Bahu Bintikar(i) Bhoop|| Kanjan Se Drig Jih Bade Banyo Su Main Daroop||2350||
translation: The king Yudhistar requesting most humbly caused the king of Yadavas to sit and now his eyes looked splendid like lotus and figure elegant like that of the god of love.2350.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry kwnH jU ko kop rwjw juiDStr Cmwpn krq Bey iDAwie ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Kaahn Joo Ko Kop Raajaa Judhishtar Chhamaapan Karat Bhae Dhiaae||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Askiing the enraged Krishna for forgiveness by Yudhistar” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ rwjw juiDStr rwjsUA j`g krq Bey ]
transliteration: Ath Raajaa Judhhishtar Raajsooa Jagg Karat Bhae||
translation: Now begins the description of the performance of the Rajsui Yajna by the king Yudhistar

gurmukhi: saupI hY syv hI pwrQ kau idj lokn kI jo pY nIkI krY ]Aru pUj krY doaU mwdRI ky puqR irKIn kI AwnMd icq DrY ]
transliteration: Saoupihai Sev Hipaarath Kau Dij Lokan Kijo Pai Neekidarai|| Ar(u) Pooj Darai Dooo Maadrike Poutra Rikheen Kiaanand Chit Ddarai||
translation: The task of serving the Brahmins was given to Arjuna; the sons of Maduri, Nakul and Sahdev, were delightfully serving the sages;

gurmukhi: BXo BIm rsoeIAw dRojoDn Dwm pY bXws qy Awidk byd rrY ]kIXo sur bwlk kYbY ko dwn su jwhI qy caudh lok frY ]2351]
transliteration: Bhayo Bheem Rasoeeaa Drojodhan Dhaam Pai Byaas Te Aadik Bed Darai|| Keeyo Sur Baalak Kaibai Ko Daan Su Jaaheee Chaudah Lok Darai||2351||
translation: Bhima became the cook and Duryodhana supervised the domestic affairs; Vyas etc. were busy in the recitation of the Vedas and Karan, the son of Surya, who frightened all the fourteen worlds, was given the task of the bestowal of charities etc.2351.

gurmukhi: sUrj cMd gnyS mhyS sdw auT kY ijh iDAwn DrY ]Ar nwrd so suk so idj bXws so sXwm BnY ijh jwp rrY ]
transliteration: Soorat Channd Gadesh Mahesh Sadaa Outh Kai Jih Dhiaan Ddarai|| Ar Naarad So Souk So Dij Byaas So Syaam Bhanai Jih Jaap Darai||
translation: He, on whom always meditate Surya, Chandra, Ganesha and Shiva; he, whose Name is repeated by Narada, Shukra and Vyasa; the mighty one,

gurmukhi: ijh mwr dXo isspwl blI ijh ky bl qy sB loku frY ]Ab ib`pn ky pg Dovq hY biRjnwQ ibnw AYsI kaun krY ]
transliteration: Jih Maar Dayo Sispaal Balijih Ke Bal Te Sabh Lok(u) Darai|| Ab Bippan Ke Pag Dhovat Hai Brijnaath Binaa Aisikaoun Darai||2352||
translation: Who killed Shishupal and from whom all the world fear, the same Krishna is now washing the feet of Brahmins and who else can perform such a task except Him.2352.

gurmukhi: Awhv kY sMg SqRn ky iqin qy kib sXwm BnY Dnu lIno ]ibpRn ko ijm byd ky bIc ilKI ibD hI iqhI BwNqih dIno ]
transliteration: Oohav Kai San Shatran Ke Tin(i) Te Kabi Syaam Bhanai Dhan(u) Leeno|| Bipran Ko Jim Bed Ke Beech Likhibidh Hitihibhaantah(i) Deeno||
translation: In the war, fighting with the enemies, the poet Shyam says, these mighty heroes realised the tax and gave gifts in charity according to the Vedic injunctions;
